title: Nothing Phone 4a and 4a Pro launching on 5 March: Design, expected specs and more
snippet: Nothing is set to launch its Phone 4 (a) series on 5 March. The launch event is also likely to see the unveling of new Headphone (a) with bold colors and long battery life. The Phone 4a will likely include a Snapdragon 7s Gen 4 processor, a triple camera setup along with a 6.78 inch OLED display.

title: OpenAI defends rival Anthropic against Pentagon ban, Sam Altman calls it ‘extremely scary precedent’
snippet: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed concerns over the US government's ban on rival Anthropic, labeling it a scary precedent. Despite OpenAI's past tensions with Anthropic, Altman defended the rival AI lab during a recent AMA session.

title: Did Grok predict US attack on Iran? Elon Musk claims victory for xAI after viral test
snippet: &nbsp;Elon Musk's Grok chatbot uniquely predicted the date of the US strike on Iran as 28 February 2026, even prior to the attack. The prediction was made by the AI chatbot in a methodological test on 25 February.

title: Anthropic's Claude AI hits number 1 spot on App Store as users boycott OpenAI's new Pentagon deal
snippet: Anthropic's Claude has jumped to the number 1 spot on the Apple App Store hours after being banned by the US government. Meanwhile, OpenAI's ChatGPT is once again facing calls for boycott and subscription cancellations after its deal with the US government.&nbsp;

title: Trump banned Anthropic — hours later, US military used its Claude AI in Iran strikes: Report
snippet: Despite announcing a phase-out, the US used Anthropic's AI during an airstrike on Iran. The technology supported intelligence and target identification, underscoring its significance in military operations, including previous use in capturing Nicolás Maduro.

title: Amid Israel-Iran conflict, FlightRadar24 starts showing error due to ‘unprecedented’ volume
snippet: Flightradar24 reported unprecedented traffic on its platform following US strikes on Iran. The company acknowledged site availability issues and stated that engineers are actively working to resolve them, thanking users for their patience.

title: Xiaomi 17 Ultra with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC, 6,330 mAh battery launched globally: Price, specs and more
snippet: Xiaomi has unveiled the Xiaomi 17 Ultra in Barcelona, featuring a Leica triple camera, Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, and a 6.9-inch OLED display. Prices start at 1,499 Euros for the base model, with IP68 rating and a 6,000mAh battery.

title: Xiaomi 17 with triple 50MP Leica cameras, 6,330mAh battery launched in India: Price, specs and more
snippet: Xiaomi launched the flagship Xiaomi 17 in Barcelona, competing with Oppo Find X9 and OnePlus 15. It offers four colors, starts at 999 Euros, features a 6.3-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 processor, Leica triple camera setup, and a 6,330mAh battery with fast charging.

title: Xiaomi 17 Ultra & Pad 8 India Launch Highlights: Xiaomi 17, Xiaomi 17 Ultra, Pad 8 series launched
snippet: Xiaomi India Launch 2026 Live Updates: Xiaomi has launched its Xiaomi 17 series at the Barcelona event. Both the phones come with a LEICA triple camera setup.

title: Xiaomi 17, Xiaomi 17 Ultra, Pad 8 global launch today: LIVE-STREAM details, expected specs, features and more
snippet: Xiaomi is launching its flagship Xiaomi 17 series and Pad 8 tablet today. The live-stream starts at 2PM Barcelona time. The Xiaomi 17 features a 6.3-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 processor, Leica triple camera, and a 7,000mAh battery with fast charging.

title: Iran crisis hits India’s economy; PE firms dial up SaaS deals
snippet: The ongoing conflict in the Middle East is likely to significantly impact Indian industries. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Iran-Israel war: Companies could see rise in digital threats, say experts
snippet: Iran-Israel war: Cybersecurity experts and consultants have issued advisories to Indian corporates warning that hackers could attempt to attack critical infrastructure including power grids, telecommunication networks, banking ATMs, as observed during Operation Sindoor.

title: Iran-Israel war: Electronics exports of $4.5 billion at risk
snippet: Iran-Israel war: The UAE was the second-largest buyer of Indian electronic products, according to data from the commerce and industry ministry. In the first nine months (April-December) of FY26, the UAE was the destination for $4.1 billion of electronics exports.

title: PE firms up SaaS buyouts as AI resets valuations & biz models
snippet: Over the past year, multiple mid-to-late stage SaaS companies have seen majority stake purchases by private equity or have consolidated internally in what is a shift from the typical venture-led growth rounds from a few years ago.

title: Govt support can help India up its eGame: Krafton India CEO
snippet: South Korean video game firm Krafton is known for developing Battlegrounds Mobile India, which has more than 100 million registered users in the country. The Korean exchange-listed company reported annual revenue of approximately $2.56 billion in fiscal year 2025.
